SEARCH

Class ContextFreeGrammar

java.lang.Object
ContextFreeGrammar
public class ContextFreeGrammar extends Object
Represents a context-free grammar with variables, terminals, rules, and a start symbol. The start symbol is the left-hand side of the first rule. Variables are the left-hand sides of all rules. Terminals are symbols on the right-hand side but not on the left-hand side. Variables and terminals include symbols from both sides of all rules.

Rules, variables, and terminals are read from a file specified in Main. The file must adhere to the specified format. The format can be found in Format class.

    • setupGrammar

      public void setupGrammar(String file) throws IOException
      Sets up the context-free grammar by reading rules from the specified file.

      This function initializes the grammar by parsing rules from the provided file. The file should adhere to a specific format in order to be parsed correctly. The format can be found in Format class.
      Parameters:
      file - The path to the file containing the grammar rules.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs while reading the file.
